required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioequivalence Study For 5 Mg Amlodipine Orally-Disintegrating Tablet
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomized, Parallel-Cohort, 2-Periods, Crossover, Single Dose Bioequivalence Study For 5 Mg Amlodipine Orally-Disintegrating Tablet In Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to determine if 5 mg amlodipine 3rd Orally-Disintegrating (OD) tablet (new formulation) and 5 mg amlodipine 2nd OD tablet (commercial formulation) are bioequivalent.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Zero Time Until the Last Sampling Time (AUCt)
primary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from zero time until the last sampling time

primary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast), Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve to Infinity (AUCinf)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: AUC last = Area under the concentration versus time curve from zero time until the last measurable concentration is calculated using the trapezoidal rule. AUCinf = AUClast + (Ct / kel), where Ct is the estimated concentration at the last measurable concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Elimination Phase Rate Constant (Kel)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated as the absolute value of the slope of a linear regression during the terminal phase of the natural-logarithm (ln) transformed concentration-time profile.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal phase half-life calculated as ln(2) / kel

secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: MRT = AUMCinf / AUCinf, where AUMCinf is the area under the first moment curve from zero time to infinity calculated as AUMCinf = AUMCt + ((t x Ct) / kel) + (Ct / kel^2). AUMCt is the area under the first moment curve from zero time to time t calculated using the trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose

arm_group.description: 24 subjects (12 subjects per sequence) will receive treatment A) one 5 mg amlodipine 3rd OD tablet (test) with water and treatment B) one 5 mg amlodipine 2nd OD tablet (reference) with water.
24 subjects (12 subjects per sequence) will receive treatment C) one 5 mg amlodipine 3rd OD tablet (test) without water, and treatment D) one 5 mg amlodipine 2nd OD tablet (reference) without water

intervention.description: 3rd OD 5 mg tablet single oral dose administered with water
2nd OD 5 mg tablet single oral dose administered with water
3rd OD 5 mg tablet single oral dose administered without water
2nd OD 5 mg tablet single oral dose administered without water

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy;
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18 to 28 kg/m2;
- total body weight within the range of 50 to 100 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of regular alcohol consumption exceeding 14 drinks/week
- Use of tobacco- or nicotine-containing products in excess of the equivalent of 10 cigarettes per day

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were screened at one center in Japan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study consisted of 2 cohorts (I and II). The design of each cohort was an open-label, randomized, 2-periods, crossover, single-dose study in healthy adult male subjects. A washout period of at least 14 days was taken between each administration in Periods 1 and 2.

group.title: 3rd OD Tablet With Water, Then 2nd OD Tablet With Water
group.description: One amlodipine third generation orally disintegrating (OD) 5 mg tablet (test) taken with water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine second generation OD 5 mg tablet (reference) taken with water during second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 2nd OD Tablet With Water, Then 3rd OD Tablet With Water
group.description: One amlodipine second generation OD 5 mg tablet (reference) taken with water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine third generation OD 5 mg tablet (test) taken with water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 3rd OD Tablet Without Water, Then 2nd OD Tablet Without Water
group.description: One amlodipine third generation OD 5 mg tablet (test) taken without water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine second generation OD 5 mg tablet (reference) taken without water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 2nd OD Tablet Without Water, Then 3rd OD Tablet Without Water
group.description: One amlodipine second generation OD 5mg tablet (reference) taken without water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine third generation OD 5 mg tablet (test) taken without water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 3rd OD Tablet With Water, Then 2nd OD Tablet With Water
group.description: One amlodipine third generation orally disintegrating (OD) 5 mg tablet (test) taken with water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine second generation OD 5 mg tablet (reference) taken with water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 2nd OD Tablet With Water, Then 3rd OD Tablet With Water
group.description: One amlodipine second generation OD 5mg tablet (reference) taken with water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine third generation OD 5 mg tablet (test) taken with water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 3rd OD Tablet Without Water, Then 2nd OD Tablet Without Water
group.description: One amlodipine third generation OD 5 mg tablet (test) taken without water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine second generation OD 5 mg tablet (reference) taken without water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: 2nd OD Tablet Without Water, Then 3rd OD Tablet Without Water
group.description: One amlodipine second generation OD 5mg tablet (reference) taken without water during the first intervention period, then one amlodipine third generation OD 5 mg tablet (test) taken without water during the second intervention period. A washout of 14 days was retained between periods.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Zero Time Until the Last Sampling Time (AUCt)
outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from zero time until the last sampling time
outcome.time_frame: prior to dosing, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 and 144 hours post dose
outcome.population: The PK parameter analysis set was defined as all subjects randomized and treated who completed the study.

group.title: Cohort I: 3rd OD Tablet (Test) With Water
group.description: Cohort I: One 5 mg amlodipine 3rd OD tablet (test) taken with water as a single oral dose

group.title: Cohort I: 2nd OD Tablet (Reference) With Water
group.description: Cohort I: One 5 mg amlodipine 2nd OD tablet (reference) taken with water as a single oral dose

group.title: Cohort II: 3rd OD Tablet (Test) Without Water
group.description: Cohort II: One 5 mg amlodipine 3rd OD tablet (test) taken without water as a single oral dose

measure.title: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Zero Time Until the Last Sampling Time (AUCt)
measure.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from zero time until the last sampling time
measure.population: The PK parameter analysis set was defined as all subjects randomized and treated who completed the study.

analysis.groups_desc: Natural log transformed AUCt was analyzed using a mixed effects model with sequence, period and formulation as fixed effects and subject within sequence as a random effect. Adjusted mean difference (test - reference) and 90% CI was obtained from the model and exponentiated to provide estimates of the ratio of adjusted geometric mean and 90% CI for the ratio. Alternative hypothesis of bioequivalence: (H1: θL <=µT - µR <=θU); null hypothesis of inequivalence: (Ho: µT - µR <θL or µT - µR >θU).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bioequivalence of the two formulations was concluded if the 90% confidence intervals for the ratio of adjusted geometric means for both AUCt and Cmax fell wholly within (80%, 125%).
analysis.estimate_desc: Parameter estimate = ratio (%) (test/reference) of adjusted geometric means.

analysis.groups_desc: Natural log transformed AUCt was analyzed using a mixed effects model with sequence, period and formulation as fixed effects and subject within sequence as a random effect. Adjusted mean difference (test - reference) and 90% CI was obtained from the model and exponentiated to provide estimates of the ratio of adjusted geometric mean and 90% CI for the ratio. Alternative hypothesis of bioequivalence: (H1: θL <=µT - µR <=θU); null hypothesis of inequivalence: (Ho: µT - µR <θL or µT - µR >θU).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bioequivalence of the two formulations was concluded if the 90% confidence intervals for the ratio of adjusted geometric means for both AUCt and Cmax fell wholly within (80%, 125%).
analysis.estimate_desc: Parameter estimate = ratio (%) (test/reference) of adjusted geometric means.

measure.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax)
measure.population: The PK parameter analysis set was defined as all subjects randomized and treated who completed the study.

analysis.groups_desc: Natural log transformed Cmax was analyzed using a mixed effects model with sequence, period and formulation as fixed effects and subject within sequence as a random effect. Adjusted mean difference (test - reference) and 90% CI was obtained from the model and exponentiated to provide estimates of the ratio of adjusted geometric mean and 90% CI for the ratio. Alternative hypothesis of bioequivalence: (H1: θL <=µT - µR <=θU); null hypothesis of inequivalence: (Ho: µT - µR <θL or µT - µR >θU).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bioequivalence of the two formulations was concluded if the 90% confidence intervals for the ratio of adjusted geometric means for both AUCt and Cmax fell wholly within (80%, 125%).

analysis.groups_desc: Natural log transformed Cmax was analyzed using a mixed effects model with sequence, period and formulation as fixed effects and subject within sequence as a random effect. Adjusted mean difference (test - reference) and 90% CI was obtained from the model and exponentiated to provide estimates of the ratio of adjusted geometric mean and 90% CI for the ratio. Alternative hypothesis of bioequivalence: (H1: θL <=µT - µR <=θU); null hypothesis of inequivalence: (Ho: µT - µR <θL or µT - µR >θU).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Bioequivalence of the two formulations was concluded if the 90% confidence intervals for the ratio of adjusted geometric means for both AUCt and Cmax fell wholly within (80%, 125%).

outcome.title: Mean Residence Time (MRT)
outcome.description: MRT = AUMCinf / AUCinf, where AUMCinf is the area under the first moment curve from zero time to infinity calculated as AUMCinf = AUMCt + ((t x Ct) / kel) + (Ct / kel^2). AUMCt is the area under the first moment curve from zero time to time t calculated using the trapezoidal method.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
